Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 90th overall pick, by Columbus in 1972...
Injured on 6/1/1973 with a Blister On Finger, out for one week...
Traded from Columbus to Boston (UBA) on 2/12/1975 (Going to PIL: 2B C. Arispe, P G. Thor, 3B J. Maes. Going to CBC: P K. Taylor)...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/2/1976, off Samuel Poitra (Ash)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/20/1976, off David Hayes (WT)...
Released by Boston (UBA) on 11/3/1976...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 11/3/1976 to a 1-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1978...
Traded from Bay City to Pontiac on 7/30/1982 (Going to PON: 3B J. Maes. Going to BC: 1B T. Evans, P B. Leatham)...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/3/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $711,900 per year...
Released by Plum Grove on 4/7/1983...
Signed as a free agent by Columbus on 2/13/1984 to a 4-year deal worth $769,888 per year...
